reason: The 'verboseLog' configuration option in the 'dconverter' software project is performance-sensitive because enabling verbose logging typically results in a significant increase in the amount of data being processed and stored. This can lead to increased execution time due to the overhead of writing detailed logs, as well as higher memory consumption to maintain the log data in memory during execution. Consequently, changes in the value of this configuration can notably impact the overall performance of the system, especially in scenarios with high transaction volumes or intensive processing tasks.
